channel.title: Blogdown on Michael W. Kearney
channel.description: Recent content in Blogdown on Michael W. Kearney

item.title: Calling out R-bloggers in my R-bloggers post
item.description: Allow me to preface this post by saying I’m a big fan of R-bloggers, a content aggregating site focused on blog posts about R. It serves a useful purpose,1 and it appears to have considerable reach.2 And although what follows may seem a bit combative, I honestly hope R-bloggers continues to operate and inspire people to use R for years to come. With that said, the goal of this post is to make the case that R-bloggers should be better.

item.title: Calling out R-bloggers in my R-bloggers post
item.description: Allow me to preface this post by saying I’m a big fan of R-bloggers, a content aggregating site focusing on blog posts about R. It serves a useful purpose–a centralized directory of “over 750” R-related blogs–and appears to have a considerable reach–50k email subscribers, 60k+ Twitter followers, etc. And although what follows may seem combative, I honestly hope R-bloggers continues to operate and inspire people to use R for years to come.
